page.title: 10RECREATION IN NORTH FAREHAM
page.content: The two main leisure provisions in this area are the public footpaths,particularly those on Wickham Common,and the shared use of Knowle Hospital's sports facilities. Wickham Common is an area of unfenced grassland and has a riding stables on it's northern edge by the A333.The stables are popular with school parties who spend about an hour trekking across the common as part of their physical education curriculum. Families often hire ponies for an evening or weekend trek.The footpaths are used for rambling,B.M.X. bikes and unofficial motorbike Scrambling which causes conflict between walkers and riders.Dog owners who allow their animals to defecate on the footpaths are also causing concern.
